title: How to Make a Fake Error Message in Windows

steps.title: Open the Notepad app
steps.content: Open the Notepad app . [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Press the ⊞ Win + R keys simultaneously. Type notepad into the Run dialog. Hit ↵ Enter or click OK .

steps.title: Copy and paste the following code into Notepad:
steps.content: Copy and paste the following code into Notepad: x=msgbox("Your Message Here", Button+Icon, "Your Title Here")

steps.title: Customize the button(s) of your error message.
steps.content: Customize the button(s) of your error message. Replace Button in the code you pasted into Notepad with one of the following: 0 - OK 1 - OK and Cancel 2 - Abort , Retry and Ignore 3 - Yes , No and Cancel 4 - Yes and No 5 - Retry and Cancel

steps.title: Customize the icon of your error message.
steps.content: Customize the icon of your error message. Replace Icon in the code that you pasted into Notepad with one of the following: 0 = No Icon 16 = Critical Icon (a.k.a. "X" icon) 32 = Question Icon (a.k.a. "?" icon) 48 = Warning Icon (a.k.a. "!" icon) 64 = Info Icon (a.k.a. "i" icon)

steps.title: Customize the title of your error message.
steps.content: Customize the title of your error message. Replace Your Title Here in the code you pasted into Notepad with what you want the title of the error message to be. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Customize the contents of your error message.
steps.content: Customize the contents of your error message. Replace Your Message Here in the code you pasted into Notepad with what you want the error message to say. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Save As window.
steps.content: Open the Save As window. Press Ctrl + S on your keyboard.

steps.title: Expand the combo box next to Save as type and select All Files.
steps.content: Expand the combo box next to Save as type and select All Files .

steps.title: Type a name for your file followed by a period and vbs.
steps.content: Type a name for your file followed by a period and vbs . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Choose a location to save the file to.
steps.content: Choose a location to save the file to.

steps.title: Save the file.
steps.content: Save the file. Click Save .

steps.title: Display the error message.
steps.content: Display the error message. Double-click the file that was created.
